Indicator.EBITDA: Betriebsergebnis vor Zinsen, Steuern und Abschreibungen (EBITDA)
Indicator.InvestmentIncome: Erträge aus Beteiligungen (und Anlagen des Finanzanlagevermögens)
Indicator.CIT: Steuern vom Einkommen und vom Ertrag

Question.COGS: Kosten zur Produktion von Wirtschaftsgütern und Dienstleistungen (inkl. Personal, bezogene Leistungen, Abschreibungen, etc.)
Question.DistributionCost: Kosten zur Vorbereitung, Förderung, Durchführung und Überwachung des Vertriebs
Question.OOI: Auflösungen von Rückstellungen, Wertzuschreibungen, Versicherungsleistungen und ähnliche
Question.OOE: Bildung von Rückstellungen, (Teil)Abschreibungen von Forderungen und ähnliche
Question.ADA: Separate Zusammenfassung von in der Summe der Herstellungskosten bereits enthaltenen Abschreibungen  (im Modell simuliert durch automatisch generierte Verteilungen von getätigten Investitionsauszahlungen über eine pauschal angenommene Laufzeit
Question.InterestRate: Zinsen auf Bankdarlehen, Schuldverschreibungen, Genußkapital und übrige Emissionen
Question.FinancialResult: Verkürzt wird das Finanzergebnis in diesem Schema pauschal als Zinsaufwand auf FInanzverbindlichkeiten ermittelt (d.h. keine positiven Zinserträge)
Question.CITRate: Pauschaler Ansatz zur Bestimmung der (erwarteten) Steuern vom Einkommen und Ertrag
Question.OpCF: Ermittelt als Jahresergebnis zzgl. Abschreibungen, abzüglich NWC-Veränderungen
Question.CAPEX: Investitionen zur Beschaffung von Vermögensgegenständen des Anlagevermögens
Question.FreeCF: Vereinfacht abgeleitet als Operativer CF abzüglich Investitionen
Question.Paydown: Rückzahlungen von Bankdarlehen, Rückkauf von Schuldverschreibungen, etc.
Question.EquityFunding: Einzahlungen aus der Ausgabe von Geschäftsanteilen, Agio, etc.
Question.PPE: Vereinfachte Bestimmung des Anlagevermögens aus Investitionen und Abschreibungen
Question.TradeReceivables: Vereinfachte Bestimmung der Forderungen als Funktion der Umsatzerlöse
Question.CCE: Kassenbestand, Bankguthaben, täglich fällige Wechsel, etc.
Question.FinancialDebt: Vereinfachte Bestimmung der Finanzverbindlichkeiten aus Investitionsauszahlungen und Kapitalrückzahlungen
Question.TradeLiabilities: Vereinfachte Bestimmung der Verbindlichkeiten als Funktion der Herstellungskosten
Question.Equity: Summe aus Kapitaleinzahlungen, Ausschüttungen, und laufendem Jahresergebnis

Description.Sales: The income statement records proceeds generated and expenditure from business operations within a given period of time.
Description.COGS: The income statement records proceeds generated and expenditure from business operations within a given period of time.
Description.NetRevenue: The income statement records proceeds generated and expenditure from business operations within a given period of time.
Description.DistributionCost: The income statement records proceeds generated and expenditure from business operations within a given period of time.
Description.SGA: The income statement records proceeds generated and expenditure from business operations within a given period of time.
Description.OOI: The income statement records proceeds generated and expenditure from business operations within a given period of time.
Description.OOE: The income statement records proceeds generated and expenditure from business operations within a given period of time.

Description.ADA: The income statement records proceeds generated and expenditure from business operations within a given period of time.
Description.EBIT: The income statement records proceeds generated and expenditure from business operations within a given period of time.
Description.EBITDA: The income statement records proceeds generated and expenditure from business operations within a given period of time.
Description.EBITDAMargin: Metrics such as salary rates, product unit prices, tax and interest rates, etc. (typically non-stacking parameters with limited or even no time sensitivity)
Description.InvestmentIncome: The income statement records proceeds generated and expenditure from business operations within a given period of time.
Description.InterestRate: Metrics such as salary rates, product unit prices, tax and interest rates, etc. (typically non-stacking parameters with limited or even no time sensitivity)
Description.FinancialResult: The income statement records proceeds generated and expenditure from business operations within a given period of time.
Description.EBT: The income statement records proceeds generated and expenditure from business operations within a given period of time.
Description.CITRate: Metrics such as salary rates, product unit prices, tax and interest rates, etc. (typically non-stacking parameters with limited or even no time sensitivity)
Description.CIT: The income statement records proceeds generated and expenditure from business operations within a given period of time.
Description.EffectiveCITRate: Metrics such as salary rates, product unit prices, tax and interest rates, etc. (typically non-stacking parameters with limited or even no time sensitivity)
Description.OtherTaxes: The income statement records proceeds generated and expenditure from business operations within a given period of time.
Description.NI: The income statement records proceeds generated and expenditure from business operations within a given period of time.
Description.NOPLAT: The income statement records proceeds generated and expenditure from business operations within a given period of time.
Description.OpCF: Flow of funds type metrics represent items directly impacting cash balances.
Description.CAPEX: These metrics represent one-time cash flow items e.g. investments accruing to PPE and increasing debt, or equity funding.
Description.FreeCF: Flow of funds type metrics represent items directly impacting cash balances.
Description.Paydown: These metrics represent one-time cash flow items e.g. investments accruing to PPE and increasing debt, or equity funding.
Description.EquityFunding: These metrics represent one-time cash flow items e.g. investments accruing to PPE and increasing debt, or equity funding.
Description.Distribution: These metrics represent one-time cash flow items e.g. investments accruing to PPE and increasing debt, or equity funding.
Description.PPE: Cash type items represent balance sheet assets in a broader sense throughout this model.
Description.TradeReceivables: Cash type items represent balance sheet assets in a broader sense throughout this model.
Description.CCE: Cash type items represent balance sheet assets in a broader sense throughout this model.
Description.NWC: Cash type items represent balance sheet assets in a broader sense throughout this model.
Description.dNWC: Flow of funds type metrics represent items directly impacting cash balances.
Description.FinancialDebt: Funding type items represent balance sheet equitable claims and liabilities in a broader sense throughout this model.
Description.TradeLiabilities: Funding type items represent balance sheet equitable claims and liabilities in a broader sense throughout this model.
Description.Equity: Funding type items represent balance sheet equitable claims and liabilities in a broader sense throughout this model.
Description.NetBalance: Cash type items represent balance sheet assets in a broader sense throughout this model.
